page.title: 09The forests of Pontycymer
page.content: Forestry is important chiefly on the north-facing slope of the valley. Planting began in 1940 and continued until the late 60's. Four species of tree are grown:- Scots pine, Japanese larch,Sitka spruce and Longpole pine. Each type of tree is suited to a particular type of soil on the valley slopes including colliery waste. The trees are felled when they are 40-50 years old , and the ground is then replanted. Two problems face the forestry:- sheep which cause damage to young trees and fires, though this risk has been reduced. Apart from economic gain, the covering of bare hillside and coaltips has restored some of the natural beauty of this region.
